Bitcoin presents an optionality that hasn’t existed in a long while. The common man has the option of continuing the rat race to maintain purchasing power OR save some of his money in Bitcoin knowing his slice of the pie will never be inflated away. All that extra work, gone.

If hyperbitcoinization of a BTC (fixed supply, high gini, low throughput) did occur, it’s not clear why this benefits humanity  Trading bankers for crypto-bankers, the wealthy for crypto-wealthy?  State powers diminishes yes, but how does this power gets restored to the people?

The Dutch tulip mania made much more sense to invest in than Bitcoin. People buying tulip bulbs had a plan for monetising them, and a valuation model. A bulb is cash generating, as it produces tulips that can be sold. There’s no organic demand for Bitcoin. It’s literally useless.
